briefdescription.para: The currently active view.
Stores the integer to be used for the next default document name.
A list of all documents.
A pointer to an instance of wxFileHistory, which manages the history of recently-visited files on the File menu.
The directory last selected by the user when opening a file.
Stores the maximum number of documents that can be opened before existing documents are closed.

detaileddescription.para: By default, this is INT_MAX i.e. practically unlimited.

briefdescription.para: Constructor.

detaileddescription.para: Create a document manager instance dynamically near the start of your application before doing any document or view operations.

If initialize is true, the Initialize() function will be called to create a default history list object. If you derive from wxDocManager, you may wish to call the base constructor with false, and then call Initialize() in your own constructor, to allow your own Initialize() or OnCreateFileHistory functions to be called.

parameterdescription.para: Indicates whether Initialize() should be called by this ctor.

briefdescription.para: Destructor.
Sets the current view.
Adds the document to the list of documents.
Adds a file to the file history list, if we have a pointer to an appropriate file menu.
Adds the template to the document manager's template list.
Search for a particular document template.

parameterdescription.para: Class info of a document class for which a wxDocTemplate had been previously created.

simplesect.para: Pointer to a wxDocTemplate, or NULL if none found.

briefdescription.para: Closes the specified document.

detaileddescription.para: If force is true, the document is closed even if it has unsaved changes.

parameterdescription.para: The document to close, must be non-NULL.
If true, close the document even if wxDocument::Close() returns false.

simplesect.para: true if the document was closed or false if closing it was cancelled by user (only in force = false case).

briefdescription.para: Closes all currently opened documents.
Creates a new document.

detaileddescription.para: This function can either create a document corresponding to a new file or to an already existing one depending on whether wxDOC_NEW is specified in the flags.

By default, this function asks the user for the type of document to open and the path to its file if it's not specified, i.e. if path is empty. Specifying wxDOC_SILENT flag suppresses any prompts and means that the path must be non-empty and there must be a registered document template handling the extension of this file, otherwise a warning message is logged and the function returns NULL. Notice that wxDOC_SILENT can be combined with wxDOC_NEW, however in this case the path must still be specified, even if the file with this path typically won't exist.

Finally notice that if this document manager was configured to allow only a limited number of simultaneously opened documents using SetMaxDocsOpen(), this function will try to close the oldest existing document if this number was reached before creating a new document. And if closing the old document fails (e.g. because it was vetoed by user), this function fails as well.

parameterdescription.para: Path to a file or an empty string. If the path is empty, the user will be asked to select it (thus, this is incompatible with the use of wxDOC_SILENT). The file should exist unless flags includes wxDOC_NEW.

By default, none. May include wxDOC_NEW to indicate that the new document corresponds to a new file and not an existing one and wxDOC_SILENT to suppress any dialogs asking the user about the file path and type.

simplesect.para: a new document object or NULL on failure.

briefdescription.para: Creates an empty new document.

detaileddescription.para: This is equivalent to calling CreateDocument() with wxDOC_NEW flags and without the file name.

briefdescription.para: Creates a new view for the given document.

detaileddescription.para: If more than one view is allowed for the document (by virtue of multiple templates mentioning the same document type), a choice of view is presented to the user.

briefdescription.para: Removes the template from the list of templates.
Appends the files in the history list to all menus managed by the file history object.
Appends the files in the history list to the given menu only.
Loads the file history from a config object.
Removes the given menu from the list of menus managed by the file history object.
Saves the file history into a config object.

detaileddescription.para: This must be called explicitly by the application.

briefdescription.para: Use this menu for appending recently-visited document filenames, for convenient access.

detaileddescription.para: Calling this function with a valid menu pointer enables the history list functionality.

simplesect.para: You can add multiple menus using this function, to be managed by the file history object.

briefdescription.para: Given a path, try to find template that matches the extension.

detaileddescription.para: This is only an approximate method of finding a template for creating a document.

briefdescription.para: Returns the document associated with the currently active view (if any).
Returns the currently active view.
Returns a reference to the list of documents.
Returns a pointer to file history.
Returns the number of files currently stored in the file history.
Returns the directory last selected by the user when opening a file.

detaileddescription.para: Initially empty.

briefdescription.para: Returns the number of documents that can be open simultaneously.
Returns a reference to the list of associated templates.
Initializes data; currently just calls OnCreateFileHistory().

detaileddescription.para: Some data cannot always be initialized in the constructor because the programmer must be given the opportunity to override functionality. If OnCreateFileHistory() was called from the constructor, an overridden virtual OnCreateFileHistory() would not be called due to C++'s 'interesting' constructor semantics. In fact Initialize() is called from the wxDocManager constructor, but this can be vetoed by passing false to the second argument, allowing the derived class's constructor to call Initialize(), possibly calling a different OnCreateFileHistory() from the default.
The bottom line: if you're not deriving from Initialize(), forget it and construct wxDocManager with no arguments.

briefdescription.para: Return a string containing a suitable default name for a new document.

detaileddescription.para: By default this is implemented by appending an integer counter to the string unnamed but can be overridden in the derived classes to do something more appropriate.

briefdescription.para: A hook to allow a derived class to create a different type of file history.

detaileddescription.para: Called from Initialize().

briefdescription.para: Closes and deletes the currently active document.
Closes and deletes all the currently opened documents.
Creates a document from a list of templates (if more than one template).
Creates a new document and reads in the selected file.
Reverts the current document by calling wxDocument::Revert() for the current document.
Saves the current document by calling wxDocument::Save() for the current document.
Calls wxDocument::SaveAs() for the current document.
Removes the document from the list of documents.

memberdef.argsstring: (wxDocTemplate **templates, int noTemplates, wxString &path, long flags, bool save=false)
memberdef.name: SelectDocumentPath

briefdescription.para: Under Windows, pops up a file selector with a list of filters corresponding to document templates.

detaileddescription.para: The wxDocTemplate corresponding to the selected file's extension is returned.
On other platforms, if there is more than one document template a choice list is popped up, followed by a file selector.
This function is used in CreateDocument().
wxPerl Note: In wxPerl templates is a reference to a list of templates. If you override this method in your document manager it must return two values, eg:

briefdescription.para: Returns a document template by asking the user (if there is more than one template).

detaileddescription.para: This function is used in CreateDocument().

templates
Pointer to an array of templates from which to choose a desired template.
noTemplates
Number of templates being pointed to by the templates pointer.
sort
If more than one template is passed into templates, then this parameter indicates whether the list of templates that the user will have to choose from is sorted or not when shown the choice box dialog. Default is false.
wxPerl Note: In wxPerl templates is a reference to a list of templates.

briefdescription.para: Returns a document template by asking the user (if there is more than one template), displaying a list of valid views.

detaileddescription.para: This function is used in CreateView(). The dialog normally will not appear because the array of templates only contains those relevant to the document in question, and often there will only be one such.

templates
Pointer to an array of templates from which to choose a desired template.
noTemplates
Number of templates being pointed to by the templates pointer.
sort
If more than one template is passed into templates, then this parameter indicates whether the list of templates that the user will have to choose from is sorted or not when shown the choice box dialog. Default is false.
wxPerl Note: In wxPerl templates is a reference to a list of templates.

briefdescription.para: Sets the directory to be displayed to the user when opening a file.

detaileddescription.para: Initially this is empty.

briefdescription.para: Sets the maximum number of documents that can be open at a time.

detaileddescription.para: By default, this is INT_MAX, i.e. the number of documents is unlimited. If you set it to 1, existing documents will be saved and deleted when the user tries to open or create a new one (similar to the behaviour of Windows Write, for example). Allowing multiple documents gives behaviour more akin to MS Word and other Multiple Document Interface applications.

briefdescription.para: Called when a file selected from the MRU list doesn't exist any more.

detaileddescription.para: The default behaviour is to remove the file from the MRU (most recently used) files list and the corresponding menu and notify the user about it but this method can be overridden to customize it.

For example, an application may want to just give an error about the missing file filename but not remove it from the file history. Or it could ask the user whether the file should be kept or removed.

Notice that this method is called only if the file selected by user from the MRU files in the menu doesn't exist, but not if opening it failed for any other reason because in the latter case the default behaviour of removing the file from the MRU list is inappropriate. If you still want to do it, you would need to do it by calling RemoveFileFromHistory() explicitly in the part of the file opening code that may fail.

parameterdescription.para: The index of the file in the MRU list, it can be passed to RemoveFileFromHistory() to remove this file from the list.
The full name of the file.

briefdescription.para: Create the frame used for print preview.

detaileddescription.para: This method can be overridden if you need to change the behaviour or appearance of the preview window. By default, a standard wxPreviewFrame is created.

parameterdescription.para: The parent window for the frame.
The suggested title for the print preview frame.

simplesect.para: A new print preview frame, must not return NULL.

briefdescription.para: The wxDocManager class is part of the document/view framework supported by wxWidgets, and cooperates with the wxView, wxDocument and wxDocTemplate classes.

detaileddescription.para: Library:wxCore
Category:Document/View Framework

simplesect.para: wxDocManager overview, wxDocument, wxView, wxDocTemplate, wxFileHistory
